description: A simple user interface to be able to view images, it was built with the python language.
howToRun: have Python installed in your computer and run python app.py or you can use the VScode run feature to run the application.
experiences: I learned how to build a user interface.
additionalInfo: I have been interested in building user interfaces for a while and I heard that PySimpleGui was a good choice to get started. I know you can also build a user interface with Java as well and I might look into that later once I master building user interfaces.

description: A ufo game similar to hangman and is run on the terminal, this project was made with the language c++.
howToRun: If you have c++ installed on your computer then you run gpp ufo.cpp then run the command ./a.exe or you can run it in VScode with the built in run feature.
experiences: I was learning more about the c++ language and I ended up building this game.
additionalInfo: I found the c++ language interesting due to how powerful and fast it executes during run time. I wanted to learn what real uses c++ has, this was a very good project to learn about c++.

description: A number guessing game made with React
howToRun: Use the npm start command to run this app.
experiences: I learned about useState and props in this project.
additionalInfo: This was the first project I made in my React Apprenticeship and I think it was a great starting point to get a better understanding of useState and passing props.

description: I made a simple store using React for the frontend. For the backend I used Express and MySQL.
howToRun: Use the npm start command to run this application, this repository is only the front end, so you also have to clone a backend I made and run those both at the same time. I will provide the link to the backend on this webpage.Because if you don't have the backend this project will not run.
experiences: I learned more about Axios and the different Http GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE methods. I learned more about MySQL and how Express works as well.
additionalInfo: I had already created a backend for BayValley Tech and I wanted to connect it to a React frontend, that is what inspired me to create this project. I need to improve the styling.

description: This is the backend that goes along with the React frontend, the backend uses Express and MySQL.
howToRun: If you run the npm start command, the project will automatically run nodemon app.js. Also make sure you have MySQL installed on your computer because that is the database I used for this project. I also used gitignore to hide my .env file so take a look at the code and create your own .env file and include the proper keys.
experiences: I learned more about nodemon and how to connect Express and MySQL.
additionalInfo: I was having trouble wrapping my head around fullstack development, but after Sarah my lead taught us about using Axios I tried testing Axios on my front end to connect to my backend and it worked. I was very happy to finally better understand fullstack development, so, thank you Sarah.

description: Login system created in c++ and is run on the terminal
howToRun: You can run this on the terminal if you have c++ installed on your system and if you run gpp app.cpp and then ./a.exe. You can also use VScode's built in run feature to run this program.
experiences: I learned how to create to files read files, and talk to files in c++.
additionalInfo: The code works fine, but I was trying to add additional features, so if you run into any issues try to debug those issues.

description: A weather app that uses React to display a 7-8 day forecast and changes upon the city the user enters
howToRun: Use npm start to run this project, also you will have to create your own .env file since I used gitignore to hide my API keys, the weather API I used has a limit on how many API calls you are allowed per key.
experiences: I learned a lot about React testing and connecting multiple API's together. I also incorporated Redux to work with my ErrorBoundary.
additionalInfo: This was a fun little project assigned to me during my apprenticeship and I learned how to use Context, Redux, and React testing.

description: A social media app made with React and Firebase.
howToRun: Run npm start to run this project.
experiences: I wanted to see how to create a social media clone, this project has a good foundation, but I was planning on adding additional features when I get time and better understand Firebase's queries.
additionalInfo: I enjoyed learning about Firebase, but I still have a lot to learn about Firebase before I can complete this application

description: Brewery Locator App made with React and allows the user to display Breweries in whichever location the user desires.
howToRun: Use npm start to run this project. Also I used a gitignore to hide my API keys, so you will have to create your own .env file and get your own API keys.
experiences: I learned how to get 2 different APIs to connect, I learned more about how to use Maps and building a map application. I learned more about form validation and utilized local storage.
additionalInfo: This was a project that we had to do for our apprenticeship and I worked with a teammate on this project. I had fun doing this project and styling it.

description: Student Directory App built with React.
howToRun: Run npm start to get this app to work.
experiences: I learned a lot about the spread operator and connecting multiple arrays together. I learned about useState, and useEffect more as well. I also learned about conditionally styling in React, form and form validation, the onChange handler and I used local storage as well.
additionalInfo: I worked on this project with a teammate of mine and we were still fairly new to React, but if we could go back and make some changes we would.
